title: NEO Surveyor Instrument Enclosure Inside Historic Chamber A
summary: The instrument enclosure of NASA’s Near-Earth Object Surveyor is prepared for critical environmental tests inside the historic Chamber A at the Space Environment Simulation Laboratory at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston in December 2024. title: ESA taps Thales Alenia Space to build digital twin for European agriculture
summary:
Europe has contracted Thales Alenia Space to develop a digital twin of agricultural systems, combining satellite data and crop modeling to support sustainable and climate-resilient farming practices across the continent.
The post ESA taps Thales Alenia Space to build digital twin for European agriculture appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Understanding Cosmic Explosions: StarBurst Arrives at NASA for Testing
summary: StarBurst, a wide-field gamma ray observatory, arrived at NASA’s Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama, March 4 for environmental testing and final instrument integration. title: NASA’s Dust Shield Successfully Repels Lunar Regolith on Moon
summary: NASA’s Electrodynamic Dust Shield (EDS) successfully demonstrated its ability to remove regolith, or lunar dust and dirt, from its various surfaces on the Moon during Firefly Aerospace’s Blue Ghost Mission 1, which concluded on March 16.
